comments.body: this should raise an exception telling the user they need the required library

The thinking behind not doing that earlier was that it would retain backward compatibility with existing installations that don't have kerberos.py installed. With that change, since the `kerberos` is in both transport schemes and will always be tried, all Windows admins would start getting exceptions until they install kerberos.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +88,92 @@        for transport, scheme in self.transport_schemes['http' if port == 5985 else 'https']:
            if transport == 'kerberos' and not HAVE_KERBEROS:
                continue
            endpoint = urlparse.urlunsplit((scheme, netloc, '/wsman', '', ''))
            vvvv('WINRM CONNECT: transport=%s endpoint=%s' % (transport, endpoint),
